resources.string:
Floorball is a type of indoor hockey that doesn't require any bulky equipment. All you need is a stick and a ball! 
The object of the game is to score more goals than your opponent. 
A competitive floorball game is officially played over three periods lasting 20 minutes each. 
When a player commits a foul, or when the ball is deemed unplayable, play is resumed from a free-hit or a face-off. 
If you break the rules your opponents get a free hit from the place the referee is pointing to. 
Face-offs are used to start the game at the beginning of each period, to re-start after each goal or in any other situation that does not result in a free hit (e.g. damaged ball).
